sentences: Ma jõuad homseks raamatud ära lugeda.
Tema ei jõua kooli enne kell kaheksat.
Me peame kiiresti tegema, et sa jõuad ajapiirdega.
context: The word 'jõuad' is the second person singular future tense form of the Estonian verb 'jõua', which means 'to reach', 'to succeed in doing something', or 'to have time'. It indicates that the subject (you) will be able to complete an action or arrive somewhere by a certain time. This word is commonly used when talking about deadlines, schedules, and completing tasks within a timeframe.
